page.title: 18St.Alphege Church
page.content: The building of the first church was begun in 1210 and considerably enlarged about 1270. To begin with the building was a nave, chancel and a big square tower between them. The chapel of St.Thomas a Becket was the first addition and later a new chancel. In the middle of the 14th century the Becket Chapel was pulled down and rebuilt as a north aisle. Nothing more was done until 1470 when the upper storey of the tower was added, with a spire 22 feet higher than the present one of 168 feet. Extensive extension work was done in 1535. In March 1757 the spire was blown down and replaced with the present one. Restoration work on spire, tower and buttressing has been done in 1841,1865,1911 & 1953. The spire is the most famous landmark in Solihull.
